t: Psalm 73
BOOK 3
The End of the Wicked Contrasted with That of the Righteous.
A Psalm of Asaph.
Surely*pn God is good to Israel, To*ln those who are pure in heart!
But*ln as for me, my feet came close to stumbling, My*ln steps had almost slipped.
For*ln I was envious of the arrogant As*iln I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
For*ln there are no pains in their death, And*ln their body is fat.
They*ln are not in trouble as*i other*i men, Nor*ln are they plagued like mankind.
Therefore*ln pride is their necklace; The*ln garment of violence covers them.
Their*ln eye bulges from fatness; The*ln imaginations of their*i heart run riot.
They*ln mock and wickedly speak of oppression; They*ln speak from on high.
They*ln have set their mouth against the heavens, And*ln their tongue parades through the earth.
Therefore*ln his people return to this place, And*ln waters of abundance are drunk by them.
They*ln say, “How does God know? And*ln is there knowledge with the Most High?”
Behold,*ln these are the wicked; And*ln always at ease, they have increased in*i wealth.
Surely*ln in vain I have kept my heart pure And*ln washed my hands in innocence;
For*ln I have been stricken all day long And*ln chastened every morning.
If*ln I had said, “I will speak thus,” Behold,*ln I would have betrayed the generation of Your children.
When*ln I pondered to understand this, It*ln was troublesome in my sight
Until*ln I came into the sanctuary of God; Then*iln I perceived their end.
Surely*ln You set them in slippery places; You*ln cast them down to destruction.
How*ln they are destroyed in a moment! They*ln are utterly swept away by sudden terrors!
Like*ln a dream when one awakes, O*ln Lord, when aroused, You will despise their form.
When*ln my heart was embittered And*ln I was pierced within,
Then*ln I was senseless and ignorant; I*ln was like*i a beast before You.
Nevertheless*ln I am continually with You; You*ln have taken hold of my right hand.
With*ln Your counsel You will guide me, And*ln afterward receive me to glory.
Whom*ln have I in heaven but*i You?*i And*ln besides You, I desire nothing on earth.
My*ln flesh and my heart may fail, But*ln God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
For,*ln behold, those who are far from You will perish; You*ln have destroyed all those who are unfaithful to You.
But*ln as for me, the nearness of God is my good; I*ln have made the Lord God*s my refuge, That*ln I may tell of all Your works.
